metadata.dc:description: HISTORY: One of the first objectives of all Ambulatory Surgical Units must be the control of quality, and these controls should at least be those given in the ASECMA guide of 1999.OBJECTIVE: The control of quality for inguinal hernias in Ambulatory Surgery. RESULTS: Between January 1997 and December 2001 we reviewed our series of 362femoral and inguinal hernioplasties performed on358 patients on an ambulatory basis.
